name: Asian Sticky Ginger Pork Ribs | Marion's Kitchen
description: All good things to those who wait… These sticky pork ribs are phenomenal already, but if you can plan ahead for overnight marinating, I promise it’ll be even more worth it. Serve with a simple ‘slaw on the side and dive right in!
keywords: Asian Steakhouse Marinades, Condiments & Sauces, Eat with your hands, Grill, How-to, Marinades, Marion’s Original Marinades, Pork, Ribs, Sticky Chilli Ginger, Weekend meals
recipeIngredient: 1 cup Marion’s Kitchen Sticky Chilli & Ginger Asian Steakhouse Marinade (recipe below)
6 cloves pickled garlic (you can also use pickled onion)

recipeInstructions.text: Step 1.For the marinade, place all the ingredients in the bowl of a food processor and blend until smooth.
Step 3.Place the ribs in a roasting tin lined with foil. Pour over half the marinade. Enclose the ribs with another sheet of foil. Place in the oven and roast for 2 hours or until fork tender.
Step 4.In the meantime, place the remaining half of the marinade in a small saucepan and simmer over medium-high heat for 2-3 minutes to thicken slightly. Remove from heat and set aside for later.
Step 6.Gently transfer the ribs to baking tray lined with foil. Baste with the remaining marinade. Place under the hot grill for 5-10 minutes or until slightly charred at the edges. Serve warm.

publisher.name: Bring the Best Flavours of Asia to Home Kitchens
